title: Drawing, 1629–33
medium: Point of brush and brown wash, pen and brown ink, red and black chalk, white chalk on off-white, pinkish laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed with point of brush and brown wash, center right: candidezza; inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper left: 277.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Design for a wall mural. In the center, one figure sits raised above a group of other figures, which all appear to be focused on the raised figure. At left, two female forms. Top left, putti suggested.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1629–33.
1629–33. Point of brush and brown wash, pen and brown ink, red and black chalk, white chalk on off-white, pinkish laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1714.
